skill.name: Provider Management
skill.description: Skill for managing model provider priorities with authentication (OAuth/Subscription/API), usage limits, and automatic fallback across all major AI providers
skill.summary: Skill for managing model provider priorities with authentication (OAuth/Subscription/API), usage lim...
skill.author: AttendantLion8

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation-only skill. No code execution, no file system access, no network calls. SKILL.md contains only command documentation for a provider management system.

content.user_title: Switch AI providers automatically with smart fallback
content.value_statement: Managing multiple AI providers with different authentication methods and usage limits creates reliability challenges. This skill provides centralized provider management with automatic fallback based on authentication priority and available capacity.
actual_capabilities: Configure authentication for Anthropic, OpenAI, Google, xAI, and other providers
Set provider priority order with automatic fallback when limits are reached
Track usage across all providers with daily and monthly limits
Manage OAuth, subscription, and API key authentication methods
Switch providers manually or enable automatic selection
List all supported models with their provider-specific model IDs
limitations: Does not execute actual API calls - only configures provider settings
Requires compatible host application for actual provider integration
OAuth flow depends on provider-specific client configuration
Usage limits are advisory unless enforced by the host application

use_cases.title: Multi-vendor AI infrastructure
use_cases.description: Configure multiple authentication methods per vendor to ensure continuous availability across different AI services

use_cases.title: Cost optimization
use_cases.description: Set usage limits and priorities to control costs while maintaining access to multiple AI models

use_cases.title: Personal AI toolkit
use_cases.description: Manage subscription, OAuth, and API key access across all major AI providers from one interface

prompt_templates.title: Check provider status
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the status of all configured AI providers including their authentication type and usage

prompt_templates.title: Add provider authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up Anthropic API authentication with my API key starting with sk-ant-

prompt_templates.title: Configure priority order
prompt_templates.prompt: Set my provider priority to use Anthropic subscription first, then Anthropic OAuth, then Anthropic API, then Bedrock

prompt_templates.title: Set usage limits
prompt_templates.prompt: Set a daily limit of 1 million tokens and monthly limit of 10 million tokens for my Anthropic API provider

output_examples.input: Show me the status of all configured AI providers
output: Anthropic providers: subscription (100), OAuth (50), API (10) - all configured
OpenAI providers: API (10) configured, OAuth not set up
Google providers: API (10) configured, OAuth not set up
Daily usage this month: 2.3M tokens total

best_practices: Configure at least two authentication methods per vendor for reliability
Set usage limits conservatively at 80% of your actual quota
Prioritize subscription authentication when available for best features
anti_patterns: Using only one authentication method creates a single point of failure
Ignoring usage limits can lead to unexpected billing
Disabling auto-switch reduces reliability when primary providers hit limits

faq.question: Which AI providers are supported?
faq.answer: All major providers including Anthropic, OpenAI, Google, xAI, Meta Llama, DeepSeek, Mistral, Cohere, and Qwen through services like Bedrock, Vertex, and OpenRouter.

faq.question: What authentication methods work?
faq.answer: Three methods: subscription tokens for Pro/Plus plans, OAuth 2.0 for personal accounts, and direct API keys for programmatic access.

faq.question: How does automatic fallback work?
faq.answer: When the primary provider reaches its usage limit, the system automatically tries the next provider in priority order until a working one is found.

faq.question: Is my credential data safe?
faq.answer: Credentials are stored locally with restricted file permissions (0600). This skill only manages configuration - actual credential storage depends on the host application.

faq.question: Why is the wrong auth method being used?
faq.answer: The system always prefers subscription over OAuth over API. Check your priority settings with provider-priority command and ensure limits are not exhausted.

faq.question: How is this different from using providers directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides unified management across all providers. You configure once and the system handles switching, limits, and fallback automatically.
